page.title: 18LONGFORD W.I. - 1940
page.content: One thing stands out in my mind which is how many more young mothers who came with their young children. Many had to walk a long distance. Very few young mothers went out to work then. The Women's Institution was the only place where we could meet. We used to meet once a month. Very few people had cars so they couldn't get into Derby as they can now-a-days. The W.I meeting was the event of the month. We always commenced with singing Jerusalem and finished with the National Anthem. We had a social half hour with games after a speaker. There was a cookery competition. There was not as much business to be done then. We used to send a delegate to the A.G.M. in London. We also used to have an annual outing to the seaside.
